name: SettingsTracker.NET
summary: An easier way to persist settings
short_description:
The harsh reality of being an object in an application is that at some point it must die. For desktop applications an object can survive quite long, frolicking about with other objects, all the while storing and modifying bits of information it caries, up until the point the user mercilessly turns the application off and decides he'd like to look at some lolcatz pictures instead for a while.

As the application is the entire universe for (managed) objects, they  When that happens, the objects that lived it surrenders its knowledge (state) and it's memory possessions to the ever hungry garbage collector, so that the memory real estate it once occupied can be used 


  In desktop applications a lot of these objects live all the way untill the applicaton shuts down.
